quote: Was Briony the only person who could hear the venom dripping from the woman’s tongue? What good was beauty — a mature beauty, but beauty nonetheless — if it cloaked such a viperous soul?
quote_letters: WAS BRIONY THE ONLY PERSON WHO COULD HEAR THE VENOM DRIPPING FROM THE WOMANS TONGUE WHAT GOOD WAS BEAUTY - A MATURE BEAUTY BUT BEAUTY NONETHELESS - IF IT CLOAKED SUCH A VIPEROUS SOUL

chat:
Twenty-two: Number between twenty-one and twenty-three.
Anatomy: Study of the structure of living organisms.
Devoted: Wished and committed fully to a purpose.
Worthy: Having value, deserving of respect.
iPhone: A smartphone developed by Apple Inc.
Lawful: Conforming to the law.
Labour: Work, especially hard physical work.
Isfahan: City in central Iran, known for its architecture.
Auguste: Given name.
Makeup: Cosmetics worn on the face.
Steven: Given name.
Subtle: Not immediately noticeable or obvious.
Hoping: Having a wish or desire for something to happen.
Archaeology: Study of past human societies through material remains.
Donations: Gifts, often to a charity or good cause.
Obscure: Not well-known or clear.
Warehouse: Large, enclosed storage space.
Rhythm: A strong, regular, repeated pattern of movement or sound.
Isotope: Variants of a chemical element with different numbers of neutrons.
Suburb: An outlying district of a city, residential in character.
Endemic: Native or restricted to a certain country or area.
